medicines.name: Amoxicillin
medicines.info: Used to treat bacterial infections. Dosage: 5–10 mg per pound every 12 hours. Precaution: complete the full course.

medicines.name: Metronidazole
medicines.info: Used for diarrhea and some parasites. May cause nausea. Dosage: 7.5 mg/lb twice daily for 5–7 days.

vaccines.name: Rabies
vaccines.info: Given at 3 months, then boosters every 1–3 years. Legally required in many areas.

vaccines.name: FVRCP
vaccines.info: Protects against viral rhinotracheitis, calicivirus, and panleukopenia. Given at 6–8 weeks and boosted regularly.

diseases.name: Feline Leukemia Virus (FeLV)
diseases.info: Causes immune suppression. Symptoms: weight loss, pale gums. Vaccine available.

diseases.name: Feline Diabetes
diseases.info: Symptoms: increased thirst, urination. Needs insulin and diet control.

behavior.name: Scratching
behavior.info: Normal behavior. Provide scratching posts to prevent furniture damage.

behavior.name: Litter Box Avoidance
behavior.info: May indicate stress or UTI. Clean box daily and rule out medical issues.

diet.name: Kitten
diet.info: High-protein kitten food 3–4 times a day. Needs taurine, DHA.

diet.name: Senior
diet.info: Low-calorie diet with joint supplements. Feed twice a day.

emergency.name: Choking
emergency.info: Open mouth and remove object if safe. Seek vet immediately.

emergency.name: Heatstroke
emergency.info: Symptoms: panting, drooling, collapse. Cool with wet towel, go to vet.

faq.question: What are common signs of illness in cats?
faq.answer: Common signs include vomiting, diarrhea, lethargy, hiding, loss of appetite, and changes in litter box habits.

faq.question: How often should I clean my cat's litter box?
faq.answer: Ideally, scoop it daily and do a full clean with soap and water once a week.

faq.question: What to do if my cat stops eating?
faq.answer: Try offering a favorite food, check for stress or illness, and consult a vet if it lasts more than 24 hours.
